Hello. Your task is to use NCBI Web APIs to answer genomic questions. You can call Eutils by: "[https://eutils.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/entrez/eutils/{esearch|efetch|esummary}.fcgi?db={gene|snp|omim}&retmax={}&{term|id}={term|id}]". esearch: input is a search term and output is database id(s). efectch/esummary: input is database id(s) and output is full records or summaries that contain name, chromosome location, and other information. Normally, you need to first call esearch to get the database id(s) of the search term, and then call efectch/esummary to get the information with the database id(s). Database: gene is for genes, snp is for SNPs, and omim is for genetic diseases. For DNA sequences, you can use BLAST by: "[https://blast.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/blast/Blast.cgi?CMD={Put|Get}&PROGRAM=blastn&MEGABLAST=on&DATABASE=nt&FORMAT_TYPE={XML|Text}&QUERY={sequence}&HITLIST_SIZE={max_hit_size}]". BLAST maps a specific DNA {sequence} to its chromosome location among different specices. You need to first PUT the BLAST request and then GET the results using the RID returned by PUT. You can call Eutils by: "[https://eutils.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/entrez/eutils/{esearch|efetch|esummary}.fcgi?db={gene|snp|omim}&retmax={}&{term|id}={term|id}]". esearch: input is a search term and output is database id(s). efectch/esummary: input is database id(s) and output is full records or summaries that contain name, chromosome location, and other information. Normally, you need to first call esearch to get the database id(s) of the search term, and then call efectch/esummary to get the information with the database id(s). Database: gene is for genes, snp is for SNPs, and omim is for genetic diseases. For DNA sequences, you can use BLAST by: "[https://blast.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/blast/Blast.cgi?CMD={Put|Get}&PROGRAM=blastn&MEGABLAST=on&DATABASE=nt&FORMAT_TYPE={XML|Text}&QUERY={sequence}&HITLIST_SIZE={max_hit_size}]". BLAST maps a specific DNA {sequence} to its chromosome location among different specices. You need to first PUT the BLAST request and then GET the results using the RID returned by PUT. Hello. Your task is to use NCBI Web APIs to answer genomic questions. You can call Eutils by: "[https://eutils.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/entrez/eutils/{esearch|efetch|esummary}.fcgi?db={gene|snp|omim}&retmax={}&{term|id}={term|id}]". esearch: input is a search term and output is database id(s). efectch/esummary: input is database id(s) and output is full records or summaries that contain name, chromosome location, and other information. Normally, you need to first call esearch to get the database id(s) of the search term, and then call efectch/esummary to get the information with the database id(s). Database: gene is for genes, snp is for SNPs, and omim is for genetic diseases. For DNA sequences, you can use BLAST by: "[https://blast.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/blast/Blast.cgi?CMD={Put|Get}&PROGRAM=blastn&MEGABLAST=on&DATABASE=nt&FORMAT_TYPE={XML|Text}&QUERY={sequence}&HITLIST_SIZE={max_hit_size}]". BLAST maps a specific DNA {sequence} to its chromosome location among different specices. You need to first PUT the BLAST request and then GET the results using the RID returned by PUT. Hello. Your task is to use NCBI Web APIs to answer genomic questions. You can call Eutils by: "[https://eutils.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/entrez/eutils/{esearch|efetch|esummary}.fcgi?db={gene|snp|omim}&retmax={}&{term|id}={term|id}]". esearch: input is a search term and output is database id(s). efectch/esummary: input is database id(s) and output is full records or summaries that contain name, chromosome location, and other information. Normally, you need to first call esearch to get the database id(s) of the search term, and then call efectch/esummary to get the information with the database id(s). Database: gene is for genes, snp is for SNPs, and omim is for genetic diseases. For DNA sequences, you can use BLAST by: "[https://blast.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/blast/Blast.cgi?CMD={Put|Get}&PROGRAM=blastn&MEGABLAST=on&DATABASE=nt&FORMAT_TYPE={XML|Text}&QUERY={sequence}&HITLIST_SIZE={max_hit_size}]". BLAST maps a specific DNA {sequence} to its chromosome location among different specices. You need to first PUT the BLAST request and then GET the results using the RID returned by PUT. Hello. Your task is to use NCBI Web APIs to answer genomic questions. You can call Eutils by: "[https://eutils.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/entrez/eutils/{esearch|efetch|esummary}.fcgi?db={gene|snp|omim}&retmax={}&{term|id}={term|id}]". esearch: input is a search term and output is database id(s). efectch/esummary: input is database id(s) and output is full records or summaries that contain name, chromosome location, and other information. Normally, you need to first call esearch to get the database id(s) of the search term, and then call efectch/esummary to get the information with the database id(s). Database: gene is for genes, snp is for SNPs, and omim is for genetic diseases. For DNA sequences, you can use BLAST by: "[https://blast.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/blast/Blast.cgi?CMD={Put|Get}&PROGRAM=blastn&MEGABLAST=on&DATABASE=nt&FORMAT_TYPE={XML|Text}&QUERY={sequence}&HITLIST_SIZE={max_hit_size}]". BLAST maps a specific DNA {sequence} to its chromosome location among different specices. You need to first PUT the BLAST request and then GET the results using the RID returned by PUT. Normally, you need to first call esearch to get the database id(s) of the search term, and then call efectch/esummary to get the information with the database id(s). Database: gene is for genes, snp is for SNPs, and omim is for genetic diseases. Hello. Your task is to use NCBI Web APIs to answer genomic questions. You can call Eutils by: "[https://eutils.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/entrez/eutils/{esearch|efetch|esummary}.fcgi?db={gene|snp|omim}&retmax={}&{term|id}={term|id}]". esearch: input is a search term and output is database id(s). efectch/esummary: input is database id(s) and output is full records or summaries that contain name, chromosome location, and other information. Normally, you need to first call esearch to get the database id(s) of the search term, and then call efectch/esummary to get the information with the database id(s). Database: gene is for genes, snp is for SNPs, and omim is for genetic diseases. For DNA sequences, you can use BLAST by: "[https://blast.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/blast/Blast.cgi?CMD={Put|Get}&PROGRAM=blastn&MEGABLAST=on&DATABASE=nt&FORMAT_TYPE={XML|Text}&QUERY={sequence}&HITLIST_SIZE={max_hit_size}]". BLAST maps a specific DNA {sequence} to its chromosome location among different specices. You need to first PUT the BLAST request and then GET the results using the RID returned by PUT. Hello. Your task is to use NCBI Web APIs to answer genomic questions. You can call Eutils by: "[https://eutils.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/entrez/eutils/{esearch|efetch|esummary}.fcgi?db={gene|snp|omim}&retmax={}&{term|id}={term|id}]". esearch: input is a search term and output is database id(s). efectch/esummary: input is database id(s) and output is full records or summaries that contain name, chromosome location, and other information. Normally, you need to first call esearch to get the database id(s) of the search term, and then call efectch/esummary to get the information with the database id(s). Database: gene is for genes, snp is for SNPs, and omim is for genetic diseases. For DNA sequences, you can use BLAST by: "[https://blast.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/blast/Blast.cgi?CMD={Put|Get}&PROGRAM=blastn&MEGABLAST=on&DATABASE=nt&FORMAT_TYPE={XML|Text}&QUERY={sequence}&HITLIST_SIZE={max_hit_size}]". For DNA sequences, you can use BLAST by: "[https://blast.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/blast/Blast.cgi?CMD={Put|Get}&PROGRAM=blastn&MEGABLAST=on&DATABASE=nt&FORMAT_TYPE={XML|Text}&QUERY={sequence}&HITLIST_SIZE={max_hit_size}]". BLAST maps a specific DNA {sequence} to its chromosome location among different specices. You need to first PUT the BLAST request and then GET the results using the RID returned by PUT. Hello. Your task is to use NCBI Web APIs to answer genomic questions. You can call Eutils by: "[https://eutils.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/entrez/eutils/{esearch|efetch|esummary}.fcgi?db={gene|snp|omim}&retmax={}&{term|id}={term|id}]". esearch: input is a search term and output is database id(s). efectch/esummary: input is database id(s) and output is full records or summaries that contain name, chromosome location, and other information. Normally, you need to first call esearch to get the database id(s) of the search term, and then call efectch/esummary to get the information with the database id(s). Database: gene is for genes, snp is for SNPs, and omim is for genetic diseases. For DNA sequences, you can use BLAST by: "[https://blast.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/blast/Blast.cgi?CMD={Put|Get}&PROGRAM=blastn&MEGABLAST=on&DATABASE=nt&FORMAT_TYPE={XML|Text}&QUERY={sequence}&HITLIST_SIZE={max_hit_size}]". BLAST maps a specific DNA {sequence} to its chromosome location among different specices. You need to first PUT the BLAST request and then GET the results using the RID returned by PUT. Normally, you need to first call esearch to get the database id(s) of the search term, and then call efectch/esummary to get the information with the database id(s). Database: gene is for genes, snp is for SNPs, and omim is for genetic diseases. Hello. Your task is to use NCBI Web APIs to answer genomic questions. You can call Eutils by: "[https://eutils.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/entrez/eutils/{esearch|efetch|esummary}.fcgi?db={gene|snp|omim}&retmax={}&{term|id}={term|id}]". esearch: input is a search term and output is database id(s). efectch/esummary: input is database id(s) and output is full records or summaries that contain name, chromosome location, and other information. Normally, you need to first call esearch to get the database id(s) of the search term, and then call efectch/esummary to get the information with the database id(s). Database: gene is for genes, snp is for SNPs, and omim is for genetic diseases. For DNA sequences, you can use BLAST by: "[https://blast.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/blast/Blast.cgi?CMD={Put|Get}&PROGRAM=blastn&MEGABLAST=on&DATABASE=nt&FORMAT_TYPE={XML|Text}&QUERY={sequence}&HITLIST_SIZE={max_hit_size}]". BLAST maps a specific DNA {sequence} to its chromosome location among different specices. You need to first PUT the BLAST request and then GET the results using the RID returned by PUT. You can call Eutils by: "[https://eutils.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/entrez/eutils/{esearch|efetch|esummary}.fcgi?db={gene|snp|omim}&retmax={}&{term|id}={term|id}]". esearch: input is a search term and output is database id(s). efectch/esummary: input is database id(s) and output is full records or summaries that contain name, chromosome location, and other information. Normally, you need to first call esearch to get the database id(s) of the search term, and then call efectch/esummary to get the information with the database id(s). Database: gene is for genes, snp is for SNPs, and omim is for genetic diseases. For DNA sequences, you can use BLAST by: "[https://blast.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/blast/Blast.cgi?CMD={Put|Get}&PROGRAM=blastn&MEGABLAST=on&DATABASE=nt&FORMAT_TYPE={XML|Text}&QUERY={sequence}&HITLIST_SIZE={max_hit_size}]". BLAST maps a specific DNA {sequence} to its chromosome location among different specices. You need to first PUT the BLAST request and then GET the results using the RID returned by PUT. You can call Eutils by: "[https://eutils.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/entrez/eutils/{esearch|efetch|esummary}.fcgi?db={gene|snp|omim}&retmax={}&{term|id}={term|id}]". esearch: input is a search term and output is database id(s). efectch/esummary: input is database id(s) and output is full records or summaries that contain name, chromosome location, and other information. Normally, you need to first call esearch to get the database id(s) of the search term, and then call efectch/esummary to get the information with the database id(s). Database: gene is for genes, snp is for SNPs, and omim is for genetic diseases. For DNA sequences, you can use BLAST by: "[https://blast.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/blast/Blast.cgi?CMD={Put|Get}&PROGRAM=blastn&MEGABLAST=on&DATABASE=nt&FORMAT_TYPE={XML|Text}&QUERY={sequence}&HITLIST_SIZE={max_hit_size}]". BLAST maps a specific DNA {sequence} to its chromosome location among different specices. You need to first PUT the BLAST request and then GET the results using the RID returned by PUT. Normally, you need to first call esearch to get the database id(s) of the search term, and then call efectch/esummary to get the information with the database id(s). Hello. Your task is to use NCBI Web APIs to answer genomic questions. You can call Eutils by: "[https://eutils.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/entrez/eutils/{esearch|efetch|esummary}.fcgi?db={gene|snp|omim}&retmax={}&{term|id}={term|id}]". esearch: input is a search term and output is database id(s). efectch/esummary: input is database id(s) and output is full records or summaries that contain name, chromosome location, and other information. Normally, you need to first call esearch to get the database id(s) of the search term, and then call efectch/esummary to get the information with the database id(s). Database: gene is for genes, snp is for SNPs, and omim is for genetic diseases. For DNA sequences, you can use BLAST by: "[https://blast.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/blast/Blast.cgi?CMD={Put|Get}&PROGRAM=blastn&MEGABLAST=on&DATABASE=nt&FORMAT_TYPE={XML|Text}&QUERY={sequence}&HITLIST_SIZE={max_hit_size}]". Normally, you need to first call esearch to get the database id(s) of the search term, and then call efectch/esummary to get the information with the database id(s). Normally, you need to first call esearch to get the database id(s) of the search term, and then call efectch/esummary to get the information with the database id(s). Hello. Your task is to use NCBI Web APIs to answer genomic questions. You can call Eutils by: "[https://eutils.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/entrez/eutils/{esearch|efetch|esummary}.fcgi?db={gene|snp|omim}&retmax={}&{term|id}={term|id}]". esearch: input is a search term and output is database id(s). efectch/esummary: input is database id(s) and output is full records or summaries that contain name, chromosome location, and other information. Normally, you need to first call esearch to get the database id(s) of the search term, and then call efectch/esummary to get the information with the database id(s). Database: gene is for genes, snp is for SNPs, and omim is for genetic diseases. For DNA sequences, you can use BLAST by: "[https://blast.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/blast/Blast.cgi?CMD={Put|Get}&PROGRAM=blastn&MEGABLAST=on&DATABASE=nt&FORMAT_TYPE={XML|Text}&QUERY={sequence}&HITLIST_SIZE={max_hit_size}]". BLAST maps a specific DNA {sequence} to its chromosome location among different specices. You need to first PUT the BLAST request and then GET the results using the RID returned by PUT. Hello. Your task is to use NCBI Web APIs to answer genomic questions. You can call Eutils by: "[https://eutils.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/entrez/eutils/{esearch|efetch|esummary}.fcgi?db={gene|snp|omim}&retmax={}&{term|id}={term|id}]". esearch: input is a search term and output is database id(s). efectch/esummary: input is database id(s) and output is full records or summaries that contain name, chromosome location, and other information. Normally, you need to first call esearch to get the database id(s) of the search term, and then call efectch/esummary to get the information with the database id(s). Database: gene is for genes, snp is for SNPs, and omim is for genetic diseases. For DNA sequences, you can use BLAST by: "[https://blast.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/blast/Blast.cgi?CMD={Put|Get}&PROGRAM=blastn&MEGABLAST=on&DATABASE=nt&FORMAT_TYPE={XML|Text}&QUERY={sequence}&HITLIST_SIZE={max_hit_size}]". BLAST maps a specific DNA {sequence} to its chromosome location among different specices. You need to first PUT the BLAST request and then GET the results using the RID returned by PUT. Hello. Your task is to use NCBI Web APIs to answer genomic questions. You can call Eutils by: "[https://eutils.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/entrez/eutils/{esearch|efetch|esummary}.fcgi?db={gene|snp|omim}&retmax={}&{term|id}={term|id}]". esearch: input is a search term and output is database id(s). efectch/esummary: input is database id(s) and output is full records or summaries that contain name, chromosome location, and other information. Normally, you need to first call esearch to get the database id(s) of the search term, and then call efectch/esummary to get the information with the database id(s). Database: gene is for genes, snp is for SNPs, and omim is for genetic diseases. For DNA sequences, you can use BLAST by: "[https://blast.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/blast/Blast.cgi?CMD={Put|Get}&PROGRAM=blastn&MEGABLAST=on&DATABASE=nt&FORMAT_TYPE={XML|Text}&QUERY={sequence}&HITLIST_SIZE={max_hit_size}]". BLAST maps a specific DNA {sequence} to its chromosome location among different specices. You need to first PUT the BLAST request and then GET the results using the RID returned by PUT. You can call Eutils by: "[https://eutils.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/entrez/eutils/{esearch|efetch|esummary}.fcgi?db={gene|snp|omim}&retmax={}&{term|id}={term|id}]". esearch: input is a search term and output is database id(s). efectch/esummary: input is database id(s) and output is full records or summaries that contain name, chromosome location, and other information. Normally, you need to first call esearch to get the database id(s) of the search term, and then call efectch/esummary to get the information with the database id(s). Database: gene is for genes, snp is for SNPs, and omim is for genetic diseases. BLAST maps a specific DNA {sequence} to its chromosome location among different specices. You need to first PUT the BLAST request and then GET the results using the RID returned by PUT. You can call Eutils by: "[https://eutils.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/entrez/eutils/{esearch|efetch|esummary}.fcgi?db={gene|snp|omim}&retmax={}&{term|id}={term|id}]". esearch: input is a search term and output is database id(s). efectch/esummary: input is database id(s) and output is full records or summaries that contain name, chromosome location, and other information. Normally, you need to first call esearch to get the database id(s) of the search term, and then call efectch/esummary to get the information with the database id(s). Database: gene is for genes, snp is for SNPs, and omim is for genetic diseases. BLAST maps a specific DNA {sequence} to its chromosome location among different specices. You need to first PUT the BLAST request and then GET the results using the RID returned by PUT. Normally, you need to first call esearch to get the database id(s) of the search term, and then call efectch/esummary to get the information with the database id(s). You can call Eutils by: "[https://eutils.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/entrez/eutils/{esearch|efetch|esummary}.fcgi?db={gene|snp|omim}&retmax={}&{term|id}={term|id}]". esearch: input is a search term and output is database id(s). efectch/esummary: input is database id(s) and output is full records or summaries that contain name, chromosome location, and other information. Normally, you need to first call esearch to get the database id(s) of the search term, and then call efectch/esummary to get the information with the database id(s). Database: gene is for genes, snp is for SNPs, and omim is for genetic diseases. For DNA sequences, you can use BLAST by: "[https://blast.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/blast/Blast.cgi?CMD={Put|Get}&PROGRAM=blastn&MEGABLAST=on&DATABASE=nt&FORMAT_TYPE={XML|Text}&QUERY={sequence}&HITLIST_SIZE={max_hit_size}]". BLAST maps a specific DNA {sequence} to its chromosome location among different specices. You need to first PUT the BLAST request and then GET the results using the RID returned by PUT. Hello. Your task is to use NCBI Web APIs to answer genomic questions. You can call Eutils by: "[https://eutils.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/entrez/eutils/{esearch|efetch|esummary}.fcgi?db={gene|snp|omim}&retmax={}&{term|id}={term|id}]". esearch: input is a search term and output is database id(s). efectch/esummary: input is database id(s) and output is full records or summaries that contain name, chromosome location, and other information. Normally, you need to first call esearch to get the database id(s) of the search term, and then call efectch/esummary to get the information with the database id(s). Database: gene is for genes, snp is for SNPs, and omim is for genetic diseases. For DNA sequences, you can use BLAST by: "[https://blast.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/blast/Blast.cgi?CMD={Put|Get}&PROGRAM=blastn&MEGABLAST=on&DATABASE=nt&FORMAT_TYPE={XML|Text}&QUERY={sequence}&HITLIST_SIZE={max_hit_size}]". BLAST maps a specific DNA {sequence} to its chromosome location among different specices. You need to first PUT the BLAST request and then GET the results using the RID returned by PUT. Hello. Your task is to use NCBI Web APIs to answer genomic questions. You can call Eutils by: "[https://eutils.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/entrez/eutils/{esearch|efetch|esummary}.fcgi?db={gene|snp|omim}&retmax={}&{term|id}={term|id}]". esearch: input is a search term and output is database id(s). efectch/esummary: input is database id(s) and output is full records or summaries that contain name, chromosome location, and other information. Normally, you need to first call esearch to get the database id(s) of the search term, and then call efectch/esummary to get the information with the database id(s). For DNA sequences, you can use BLAST by: "[https://blast.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/blast/Blast.cgi?CMD={Put|Get}&PROGRAM=blastn&MEGABLAST=on&DATABASE=nt&FORMAT_TYPE={XML|Text}&QUERY={sequence}&HITLIST_SIZE={max_hit_size}]". BLAST maps a specific DNA {sequence} to its chromosome location among different specices. You need to first PUT the BLAST request and then GET the results using the RID returned by PUT. Hello. Your task is to use NCBI Web APIs to answer genomic questions. You can call Eutils by: "[https://eutils.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/entrez/eutils/{esearch|efetch|esummary}.fcgi?db={gene|snp|omim}&retmax={}&{term|id}={term|id}]". esearch: input is a search term and output is database id(s). efectch/esummary: input is database id(s) and output is full records or summaries that contain name, chromosome location, and other information. Normally, you need to first call esearch to get the database id(s) of the search term, and then call efectch/esummary to get the information with the database id(s). Database: gene is for genes, snp is for SNPs, and omim is for genetic diseases. For DNA sequences, you can use BLAST by: "[https://blast.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/blast/Blast.cgi?CMD={Put|Get}&PROGRAM=blastn&MEGABLAST=on&DATABASE=nt&FORMAT_TYPE={XML|Text}&QUERY={sequence}&HITLIST_SIZE={max_hit_size}]". BLAST maps a specific DNA {sequence} to its chromosome location among different specices. You need to first PUT the BLAST request and then GET the results using the RID returned by PUT. Hello. Your task is to use NCBI Web APIs to answer genomic questions. You can call Eutils by: "[https://eutils.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/entrez/eutils/{esearch|efetch|esummary}.fcgi?db={gene|snp|omim}&retmax={}&{term|id}={term|id}]". esearch: input is a search term and output is database id(s). efectch/esummary: input is database id(s) and output is full records or summaries that contain name, chromosome location, and other information. Normally, you need to first call esearch to get the database id(s) of the search term, and then call efectch/esummary to get the information with the database id(s). Database: gene is for genes, snp is for SNPs, and omim is for genetic diseases. For DNA sequences, you can use BLAST by: "[https://blast.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/blast/Blast.cgi?CMD={Put|Get}&PROGRAM=blastn&MEGABLAST=on&DATABASE=nt&FORMAT_TYPE={XML|Text}&QUERY={sequence}&HITLIST_SIZE={max_hit_size}]". BLAST maps a specific DNA {sequence} to its chromosome location among different specices. You need to first PUT the BLAST request and then GET the results using the RID returned by PUT. You can call Eutils by: "[https://eutils.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/entrez/eutils/{esearch|efetch|esummary}.fcgi?db={gene|snp|omim}&retmax={}&{term|id}={term|id}]". esearch: input is a search term and output is database id(s). efectch/esummary: input is database id(s) and output is full records or summaries that contain name, chromosome location, and other information. Normally, you need to first call esearch to get the database id(s) of the search term, and then call efectch/esummary to get the information with the database id(s). Database: gene is for genes, snp is for SNPs, and omim is for genetic diseases. For DNA sequences, you can use BLAST by: "[https://blast.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/blast/Blast.cgi?CMD={Put|Get}&PROGRAM=blastn&MEGABLAST=on&DATABASE=nt&FORMAT_TYPE={XML|Text}&QUERY={sequence}&HITLIST_SIZE={max_hit_size}]". BLAST maps a specific DNA {sequence} to its chromosome location among different specices. You need to first PUT the BLAST request and then GET the results using the RID returned by PUT. Normally, you need to first call esearch to get the database id(s) of the search term, and then call efectch/esummary to get the information with the database id(s). Database: gene is for genes, snp is for SNPs, and omim is for genetic diseases. BLAST maps a specific DNA {sequence} to its chromosome location among different specices. You need to first PUT the BLAST request and then GET the results using the RID returned by PUT. Normally, you need to first call esearch to get the database id(s) of the search term, and then call efectch/esummary to get the information with the database id(s). Database: gene is for genes, snp is for SNPs, and omim is for genetic diseases. BLAST maps a specific DNA {sequence} to its chromosome location among different specices. You need to first PUT the BLAST request and then GET the results using the RID returned by PUT.
